page.title: 04CRESSBROOK VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: {EDUCATION CRESSBROOK WARDLOW {Cressbrook School}consists of one classroom,a kitchen cum dining-room, a small cloakroom and a playground.There are 18 pupils with ages ranging from 5-11 years. Those from Litton Mill and Wardlow come by taxi,but most Wardlow children attend Great Hucklow school.At 11years of age they transfer to the large comprehensive school at Bakewell. In addition to the usual subjects taught,pupils swim at Edensor pool, join Ashford pupils for extra sports, and perform plays at Christmas. There are 2 teachers and a welfare assistant who travel from outside the area.Despite this fact the school rarely closes in bad weather.In September,when the numbers drop to 13, the assistant may have to leave.The lunches are cooked by a part-time cook
